intro: Cissampelos capensis, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that turn red when mature, containing seeds enclosed in a fleshy pulp. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
